misconception_name: Believes multiplying two negatives gives a negative answer
construct_name: Carry out division  problems involving one negative integer
question_text:
Tom and Katie are trying to write different calculations for the diagram on the left.
Tom writes: \( -3 \times(-8)=-24 \)
Katie writes: \( \frac{(-24)}{-3}=-8 \)
Who is correct? ![A diagram showing an arrow to the left, marked with a value of -24. Underneath this arrow there is a smaller arrow, still pointing to the left, that is a third of the length of the larger arrow]()

Who is correct?

\hline
